title: Cooking Fish in Survival Situations
brief: Learn multiple methods to cook fish effectively using available materials.
steps: Step 1: For whole fish: impale on a stick and cook over open fire, turning frequently.
Step 2: For boiling: cook fish with skin on to save fats and oils for nutritious broth.
Step 3: For clay cooking: pack whole fish in clay ball and bury in fire coals until clay hardens, then break open.
Step 4: Test doneness - fish is cooked when meat flakes off easily.
Step 5: For preservation: smoke or fry the fish if keeping for later use.
warnings: Ensure fish is fully cooked - raw fish can carry parasites.
Don't overcook as this reduces nutritional value.
Save cooking liquids for additional nutrition.
